fields.description: We've had situations where multiple people are working on the same JIRA ticket, and are overwriting eachother's work whenever they use the JIRA issue's inline editor rather than clicking on the "edit" button, which pulls up a modal that seems to have it's data refreshed from the server. If the inline editor doesn't refresh its content from the server before letting the user make modification, is there any way to turn the inline editor off? If not, this is a pretty big bug for us because we continue to have to troll through an issue's history to ensure that we're not overwriting one another.

fields.description:
Get a sorted list of searchable fields is more than 160 times slower in JIRA 6 than in JIRA 5.2. This comes from the fact that translatable field names was introduced in JIRA 6 which means that JIRA has to get a property set for each field where the translated name is stored for that field when it get the field's name now.

These property sets should be cached but it looks like if there is a high number of fields most of the caches are empty and have to be looked up from the DB from scratch which is taking all the time. 

We need to introduce a more performant field name cache in JIRA.

*Workaround*
Upgrade to JIRA 6.0.1
fields.summary: Searchable Fields Slow - Get a sorted list of searchable fields is more than 160 times slower

fields.description:
Although attachment size limit was changed from 10MB to 20MB from JIRA Admin (OnDemand) but it has not taken effect for attachments entering JIRA via email. If issues is created via JIRA UI then it's OK.

Reproduce steps:

1. Configured a mail handle *Create Issue & Comment on existing issue* using OnDemand *POP Mail Server (mailstore)*.
2. Configure attachment size limit (System -> Advanced -> Attachment). From 10MB to 20MB.
3. Use gmail to send many emails to mail handler
4. If the email does not include attachment or attachment size less than 10MB then issues is created.
5. How ever, if the attachment size is 10.4MB, it is rejected (see screen shoot).
6. If issue is created via OnDemand UI, user can attach 10.4MB file without any problems.

Please help

Regards
Steven

h3. Resolution

Customers are advised to host their own POP server if they wish to handle bigger issue attachments. 

The limit of 10 MB for the Atlassian OnDemand POP server needs to stay in place due to resource consumption limitations.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand unable to create issues with email attachment more than 10MB

fields.description:
When the 'Copy Field Value to Parent ' post-function is set on a Sub-task workflow transition for a custom field (on my test case it was a 'Multi Checkboxes' field type), the sub-task's custom field value is correctly reflected on the 'Issue Navigator' when performing a query parsing the custom field value.
While the sub-task's parent custom field value is not directly reflected on the 'Issue Navigator'. Only after performing a 'Lock JIRA and rebuild index' it is updated. Not even the 'Background re-index' is effected.

Steps to reproduce:
* Add a custom field to a screen.
* Add the 'Copy Field Value to Parent' post-function to a workflow transition that is applied to the sub-task (on my test case it was from 'In Progress' to 'Close').
* Add the 'Clear Field Value ' post-function to the same workflow transition for the same custom field, and place it above (to be executed first) of the 'Copy Field Value to Parent' post-function.
* Create an issue (parent) populating the custom field.
* Create a sub-task for this recently created issue, populating this custom field with a value.
* Make the workflow transition, so the above post-functions can be executed.
* Perform a query on the 'Issue Navigator' for the custom field value that was populated when the parent issue was created (it should be cleared now, and it is, but the index for the parent issue was not successfully built)
fields.summary: 'Copy Field Value to Parent' post function not completely re-indexing parent issues

fields.description:

Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a JIRA OnDemand instance with other services (e.g. Confluence and/or Bamboo).
# Set up the DVCS Connector and a Bitbucket project in such a way that the system dashboard's activity stream is showing commits to the project.
# Edit the system dashboard's activity stream gadget and uncheck one or more of the providers, aside from "JIRA".

Note that the DVCS commits are no longer showing in the stream.

The DVCS Connector is not listed as a provider. The entries seem to be a part of the "JIRA" provider. I'm not sure what the convention should be here, but unchecking an unrelated service (e.g. Confluence, Bamboo, Tempo, etc.) should not remove its entries from the stream.
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget excludes DVCS Connector entries when not all providers are selected

fields.description:
*Performing a Bulk Edit from a filter that itself references the new/old edit fields returns a 404 (dead link)*

I believe I've narrowed this down to a 100% repro bug...

*Steps to Reproduce:*
_1. Create a new search filter with syntax:_

{code}
project = <projectname> AND component in ("<component1>", "<component2>")
{code}

_2. *Tools* > *Bulk Edit*_
Link reference: https://warchest.atlassian.net/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEditDetails.jspa )

_3. Select an issue whose Component is currently set to *component1*_
Link reference: https://warchest.atlassian.net/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkChooseOperation!default.jspa

_4. Select Edit and set the Component field to *component2*_
Link reference: https://warchest.atlassian.net/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEditDetailsValidation.jspa

_5. Select *Confirm*_

*Expected Behaviour:*
* The bulk edit action completes correctly and the user is returned to the filter used as the basis for the previous Bulk Edit operation.

*Actual Behaviour:*
* The bulk edit action completes silently (no confirmation), but successfully (the component is reassigned successfully).
* However, the user is taken through to the following dead link: https://warchest.atlassian.net/issues/?redirectedFromClassic=

*Impact:*
* The user is not initially aware if their operation has been successful or not (confusing)
* The user may waste time investigating if there is an issue with their internal network (I know I did)
* Every time I perform one of these operations, I lose the filter I had created and have to start over (very frustrating)

*Notes:*
* During the Bulk Edit I am in the habit of switching off emails (have not tested with emails on)
* The issue reproduced whether the filter is derived from a Basic or Advanced search method
* The source of the issue seems to be that the filter results  page that the operation attempts to return to now contains different information
* This does not occur if the neither the new or the old component that has been set are referenced in the original filter
fields.summary: Performing a Bulk Edit from a filter that itself references the new/old edit fields returns a 404 (dead link)
Wiki markup for Confluence Page link not working

fields.description:
*JIRA OnDemand - Text Display - Integers immediately preceded by the letter 'r' display as null strings*

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue
# Enter the following text into the _Description_ field: "*r12345*"
# Submit the issue
# Enter the following text into the _Comments_ field: "*r12345*"

*Expected Result:*
User-defined text displays as entered, with any Wiki Markup formatting applied

*Actual Result:*
The string does not display at all (null string) for either the _Description_ or the _Comments_ field

*Impact:*
* Developers are used to entering references to changes they make  by referring to a specific commit revision
* They are in the habit of writing this in the format: "*r#####*" (e.g. "*r12345*")
* If they maintain this habit, JIRA currently _*does not display this crucial information*_

*Notes:*
* If you go back to edit the field, the text is still there
* This appears to be a relatively new issue, I've only noticed it happening within the past week or so (current date is 27-JAN-2014); I feel like I probably would have noticed this behaviour sooner if it had been happening for a longer time
* I have taken a look in the JIRA Admin panel and can't see anything obvious that could be causing revision references in this format to fail to display
* The project affected can be found at warchest.atlassian.com
* We have many non-default add-ons installed (FishEye, Cruciple), but we don't actively use any of them as far as I can see
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand - Rich Text Display - Integers immediately preceded by the letter 'r' display as null strings

fields.description:
In the latest OnDemand version, when a user configured Webhooks to be triggered by using workflow post functions instead of the _Events_ the Webhook seems not to be fired. However, when the Webhoook is configured to be triggered by Event the Webhook is fired accordingly.

*Steps to produce:*
# Create a Webhook to fire the events to an external platform
# Configure workflow pos functions to fire the Webhook instead of using _Events_
# Perform the transactions that suppose to fire the webhook

*Expected Results*:
The webhook should be fired to the external platform

*Actual Results:*
Nothing is fired.
fields.summary: WebHooks not firing when the event triggered is Workflow post function

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* In detail view, click the comment button on an issue that has a vertical scrollbar
* Type some text and then @-mention someone
* Now scroll the page

Expected:
* The @-mention dropdown menu scrolls with the page 

Actual:
* The @-mention dropdown stalks
fields.summary: Mentions drop-down stalks in detail view

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* In OnDemand, view an issue
* Click on the project avatar on the top left

Expected:
* JIRA shows a dialog with links to the Confluence space with the same name

Actual:
* Nothing happens
fields.summary: Project navigation link is broken in JIRA 6.0

fields.description:
http://www.timeanddate.com/ shows that [Vladivostok|http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/city.html?n=261] currently has the time zone GMT+11

When selecting Vladivostok in Jira OnDemand this shows GMT+10:

fields.description: When you click on any of the other tabs in the Activity section of any Issue, it only displays a find_link message
fields.summary: Tabs in the Activity section only display a find_link message

fields.description:
The OnDemand JIRA exporter strips out group memberships to the _licensed-jira group which is expected since JIRA standalone does not have a concept of application access.

However, we should implement a post-process that adds the disabled user attribute to JIRA users that do not have application access
fields.summary: When exporting from JIRA OnDemand users without application access are not deactivated

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We have the need to default the Tempo Account Key by project. It seems to work if the project is only associated to one Account Key, but if a project is associated to multiple Account Keys then the default value setting via Custom Field it's not retained.

h3. Actual Behavior (scenarios)
# If a project is only associated to a single Tempo Account Key (via Tempo *Account Manager* page) then the default value can be set on the Custom Field's settings and is honored when an issue is created. The default value is retained in settings and the value defaults correctly upon issue creation.
# If a project is associated to multiple Tempo Account Keys (via Tempo *Account Manager* page) then the default value is not retained in the Custom Field's settings and it's not defaulted upon issue creation.

h3. Expected behavior
A project should be configurable such that when an issue is created, it will default the value of the Tempo Account Key field to a specific value.

For instance, a company that has multiple business units/departments and projects are usually charged to a specific department. When issues are created, the Tempo Account Key  should by default be set to a default value based on the department that the project is charged to. This way, when someone logs work to that issue the time can be allocated to the proper department.
fields.summary: Default value for custom Tempo Account Key field not working

fields.description:
Previously, the status(es) would wrap within the Two Dimensional filter to ensure it fit neatly within a column without the need to scroll. 

Now that lozenges are being used for status(es) this is not happening.
fields.summary: JIRA Status Lozenges do not wrap in Two Dimensional Filter

fields.description:
When a custom field is created as a Cascading Select field type, and after, issues are created and this Cascading Select field is filled, then work is estimated and logged on these issues, and a Time Sheet report is generated selecting this field on the "Group by Field" option on the report's configuration, or the same using the Time Sheet gadget, this field is not shown properly. It is shown with something like: {null=xxxxxx}, where xxxxxx is the option selected on the cascading field.
The same when you use Excel view.

Check screenshots attached.

Gadgets affected:
* Time sheet gadget
* Excel view
* Issue Statistics Gadget
* Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget
* Heatmap Gadget
* probably others
fields.summary: Cascading Select field type do not displays properly on Time Sheet gadget and Excel view

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

We have added project icons to our instance of Jira running on OnDemand.

The icons look great in Chrome but appear very large in IE11.
fields.summary: Project Icons Appear Incorrectly in IE11

fields.description: The FlowdockEventRenderer appears to be holding on to an !18nHelper longer than is necessary as we see it often in our memory dumps.  It is not a good idea to hold onto this object as you may then end up bound to the wrong Locale, and you will not get any new keys/value pairs that are added by other plugins.
fields.summary: Flowdock plugin holds on to an I18nHelper

fields.description:
Tempo version 7.8 recently upgraded on OnDemand incorporates [Agile Timesheet|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/wiki/display/TEMPO/Agile+Timesheet] as described in [Tempo Timesheets 7.8 Release Notes|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/wiki/display/TT/Tempo+Timesheets+7.8+Release+Notes]

This incorporates a new button for Agile Boards:
!tempo-timesheets-u-agile-board-timesheet-open-time-tracking.png!

but when the plugin is disabled or without a valid license, the Agile Board button is still visible but without an option:
!jira-tempo.png!

*Cause:*
The "System Plugin: Tempo Core" provides that functionality and disabling the user addon "Tempo Timesheets" doesn't disable the System plugin that is only accessible to system-administrators.

*Workaround:*
* Request support to disable all Tempo Plugins
fields.summary: Tempo button on Agile Board visible although plugin is disabled

fields.description:
When a user creates a gadget and in a config part puts a filterPicker field, using AJS.gadget.fields.filterPicker(), the created html contains a chunk of the following code:

<div id="quickfind-container">

This obviously prevents creation of multiple instances of the filterPicker field in the same html page.

The solution would be to prefix/sufix the id with the user-provided field name, just like the rest of the DOM elements, generated for filterPicker(), like: <div id="proj_filter_picker_example-field1">

I haven't check the projectPicker() too, but it might be a good idea to check its code just to make sure it doesn't also generate DOM elements with unique ids.

My JIRA version is: v6.1-20130626#6131-sha1:10804a8
fields.summary: AJS.gadget.fields.filterPicker() uses a unique id preventing multiple instances

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*

# Create a workflow that does not have any conditions on the resolve or close transitions
# Set the permissions for a project so that a specific user does not have 'Resolve Issue' or 'Close Issue' permission
# Use the JIRA Admin Helper to check if that user can 'Close Issues' - the answer should be no
# Close the issue with that user.

Because the JIRA Admin Helper looks at the 'Resolve Issue' and 'Close Issue' permissions it can be very misleading (potentially dangerously so) if those permissions and not used in the workflow.
fields.summary: 'Close Issue' permission check in admin helper is misleading

fields.description: In JIRA OnDemand when users migrate from OnDemand to Standalone, by backing-up their system using the *backup manager*. After the import process is done successfully with no errors on the JIRA Standalone side, the Mail Handlers will not be restored on the Standalone system. The Mail Handler section will be empty.
fields.summary: Mail Handlers are not restored when migrating data from JIRA Cloud to Server

fields.description:
If a user tries to log in that does not have application access returns the user to the front page with no error message.

After this, clicking on 'log in' the user will be redirected to the front page again without any message. The user will not be able to log in or out until application access has been granted.
fields.summary: Trying to log in as a user without application access gives no warning or error

fields.description: When selecting the date via the datapicker on project versions management screen (see screenshot 1 attached) the date is inserted in format dd/mm/yy (see screenshot 2). The error comes up when adding the version, requiring the date to be entered in dd/MMM/yy format.
fields.summary: Versions datepicket doesn't provide date in valid format

fields.description:
The changeset link mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+Links] "r#####" causes HTML emails to not render properly.

It's the same issue outlined here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26706
fields.summary: Error in html email from Application Linkers plugin with changeset links

fields.description: Timezone data on OnDemand instances is out of date. In particular it contains incorrect data for Europe/Moscow timezone. This does not manifest in code that uses joda time as this library maintains its own database and currently is up to date. The problem can be observed when Java's standard library is used.
fields.summary: Timezone database in JDK in OnDemand out of date

We're running version 6.3-OD-01-067 (which doesn't exist in the dropdown below (it says "Version with id '6.3-OD-01-067' does not exist.")).

fields.description:
When you browse to the Backup page in JIRA, it should be made very clear that there's a minimum interval between backups. By waiting until the user clicks 'Backup' before showing an error, users get a false sense of confidence that they can actually perform the action.

This can lead to problems in larger companies when scheduling backups.
fields.summary: Make the minimum interval between backups more obvious for OnDemand users.

fields.description:
[~andreask@atlassian.com] picked up on what was going on here, from his comment on the support case where this was discovered:

{quote}
* Add a comment with a security level that certain users are allowed to see and other users aren't allowed to see due to the security level (those other users should have permission to browse the issue though!)
* Edit that comment and remove the security level. We should now send a notification to all users with browse permission, including the ones that didn't have permission to see the comment previously due to the security level that was set
* The null pointer exception occurs I think because we remove the originalcomment from the velocity context for users that didn't have permission previously to see it. When we try to diff the original comment with the new comment for those new users we get a NPE since the original is not provided.
{quote}

The diff to the previous comment shouldn't occur if there's no original.

The stack trace in the logs looks like this:

See screenshot attached. 
I am submitting this on behalf of a friend Peter Bloom at autogridsystems who sent this screenshot to me.

I am not sure the steps to recreate this issue, though it may be obvious from the screenshot.

Thanks!
fields.summary:
Name matching showing

tags

fields.description:
1. I have a Jira issue with labels "A", "B" and "C".
2. I go to edit the labels, I remove "C"
3. I then add label "D"
4. I decide to re-add label "C"
5. Label "C" doesn't appears in the label list, worse yet, if I type in "C" it asks me if I want to create a new "C" label
fields.summary: Label editing - label cannot be selected if previously removed

fields.description:
We say we only support English (US) but in reality it looks as though we only ship with the default language pack - English (UK). E.g. In OnDemand they are "Favourite Filters" not "Favorite Filters"

The locale in the profile is - "English (United States) [Default]"

We most probably just need to bundle the American translations.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand locale is actually English (UK) not English (US)

fields.summary: The project switcher's "related links" fail to load with java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/fugue/Options

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. create a Custom Field with editable available options (_Select List_, _Multi Select_, _Cascading Select_, _Radio Buttons_, _Multi Checkboxes_ etc.)
2. go to the _Edit Options for Custom Field_ screen;
3. see the note mentioning that HTML use is possible, although it's a Restricted Function:

!Screen shot 2013-04-29 at 11.39.49 AM.png|thumbnail!


This note is misleading to the users and should be removed.
fields.summary: JIRA Custom Field configuration screen states that HTML is available
Duplicate Custom Fields causing Basic search error

fields.description:
This issue has been reported in OnDemand instances using the Zendesk Connector and users selecting 'Remote Attachments' on the activity panel of an issue.

Customware support are working with affected customers.

Until we are advised of a permanent solution from the plugin provider, the temporary workaround for this error is as follows:
1. Affected users perform a hard refresh to clear cookies and cache from their browser and refresh their view of tickets.  The error will occur whenever the 'Remote Attachments' are selected.
+OR+
2. Disable the 'Activitymodule' in the 'View Issue Panel' plugin from OnDemand, this will prevent all other panels being available for viewing and only comments would be visible for all users of the instance

The related log indicates: 
{noformat}
com.atlassian.templaterenderer.RenderingException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in  class net.customware.plugins.connector.jira.issue.attachment.action.AttachmentTabAction threw exception java.lang.ClassCastException: net.customware.plugins.connector.zendesk.manager.impl.DefaultZendeskManager cannot be cast to net.customware.plugins.connector.core.integration.manager.AttachmentAwareRemoteManager at viewissue/activityblock.vm
{noformat}

fields.summary: Calendar in Project Overview is blank

fields.description:
On the Time Sheet Report page, the AUI message is broken.

Steps to reproduce:

# Generate a time sheet report for a project (Project → Overview → Reports → Time Sheet Report → Next)
# Observe the broken AUI message:

!Screen Shot 2013-09-18 at 12.03.58 PM.png!
fields.summary: Time Sheet Report AUI message broken

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Leave a comment on an issue.
# Reload the issue a few hours later.

Notice that it simply says "Today" for the date, rather than also specifying the time (same for "Yesterday", "_x_ days ago", etc.).
fields.summary: Relative dates in comments and issue created/updated don't show the timestamp after upgrade to JIRA 6.3-OD-1

fields.description:
The system error pop-up is displayed from an unsuccessful action, the hyperlink for the text 'Support Request Page' redirects to an invalid location for OnDemand users: https://<example_site>/plugins/servlet/stp/view/#create-support-request

Could this hyperlink be updated to redirect to support.atlassian.com in the case of OnDemand instances.
fields.summary: System Error pop-up doesn't navigate to valid location for OnDemand users
